concept_data.title: Countries of the Council of Europe

summary: The concept "Countries of the Council of Europe," which redirects to the preferred term "Council of Europe countries," encompasses the member states that participate in the Council of Europe, an organization dedicated to promoting human rights, democracy, and the rule of law across Europe. In the context of EU legal and regulatory documents, these countries play a significant role in shaping policies that align with European values and standards. The Council of Europe countries engage in various treaties and conventions that influence EU legislation, particularly in areas such as human rights protection and cross-border cooperation, thereby enhancing the legal framework within which EU member states operate.
